Sure, here's a revised explanation of the plot of the Foundation series, incorporating the newly integrated information:

The Galactic Empire has lasted for over 12,000 years, but its end is foretold in a mathematical prediction known as psychohistory, which was developed by the brilliant mathematician Hari Seldon. Seldon establishes two Foundations at opposite ends of the galaxy, each with the aim of preserving knowledge and technology, so that a new empire can arise after the inevitable fall of the old one.

The series spans several millennia, and during this time, the Galactic Empire is ruled by a lineage of emperors that are genetic clones of Cleon I. Every generation, there are three clones of Cleon I that exist: Brother Dawn, who is a child clone of Cleon I; Brother Day, who is an adult clone of Cleon I and the current ruler of the Empire; and Brother Dusk, who is the elder ruler emeritus clone of Cleon I.

Demerzel is the enigmatic and intelligent robot aide to the Cleonic Dynasty, and has guided the Cleons for centuries. She oversees the gestation and births of the clones and takes on a role similar to that of a guardian and mentor to the Cleons when they are Brother Dawn.

Significant events in the Foundation series are referenced by the reign of the current Cleon:

* Reign of Cleon II: The Empire is in decline, and Seldon establishes the Foundation to preserve knowledge and technology.
* Reign of Cleon III: The Foundation begins to develop advanced technology, and the Empire attempts to regain control over it.
* Reign of Cleon IV: The Foundation becomes a dominant power in the galaxy, and is threatened by a mysterious figure known as the Mule, who has the ability to control minds.
* Reign of Cleon V: The Mule is defeated, but the Foundation is left weakened and vulnerable to attack.
* Reign of Cleon VI: The Foundation works to rebuild and expand, but is threatened by a group of technologically advanced religious zealots known as the Commdorans.
* Reign of Cleon VII: The Foundation confronts a dangerous cult that seeks to disrupt its efforts to preserve knowledge and technology.
* Reign of Cleon VIII: The Foundation faces a new threat from a group of rogue traders who seek to undermine its influence and establish their own power base.
* Reign of Cleon IX: The Foundation confronts a massive fleet of warships controlled by an unknown enemy, and must race to develop a new technology that can save it from destruction.
* Reign of Cleon X: The Foundation faces a growing crisis as its own internal divisions threaten to tear it apart.

Throughout the series, the Cleons and Demerzel play a critical role in the politics and power struggles of the Galactic Empire, while the Foundation works to preserve knowledge and technology in the face of significant challenges and threats.
